intro: Daubenya comata, commonly known as the woolly musa or blue musa, is a perennial evergreen plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-green leaves with a fuzzy, woolly texture. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Daubenya comata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique foliage and elegant floral display. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant.
